You are about to salvage a powerful item. Are you sure?
You cannot salvage. Your inventory is full.
Cannot salvage because {currency} is at maximum capacity.
You cannot equip this item in this slot
You need {expansionName} to equip this item
Please fill in rating or feedback
You have played {days} days {hours} hours {minutes} minutes and {seconds} seconds.
If you run out of wound resistance, you will become wounded and regain stamina at a much lower rate.
If you run out of corruption resistance, you will become corrupted and take damage equal to {[Type_StatusEffectData.Curse.HealthModifierPercent * -100]}% base health instantly.
If you run out of frostbite resistance, you will become frostbitten and be unable to run or dodge for {[Afflictions.AfflictionFrostBite.AfflictedDrainTime]} seconds.
If you run out of acid resistance, you will suffer Acid burn and take 500% more damage from acid. You can remove Acid Burn with Acid Tinctures which can be crafted at an arcane station.
If you run out of breath, you suffocate and die.
If you get concussed enough, you get stunned and can't move.
If you run out of spores resistance, you will become spore drenched and take 25% increased damage from all sources.

If you run out of blight resistance, you will become blighted and deal {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.DMGStandard * 100]}% reduced damage, take {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealMod * 100]}% reduced healing, and lose {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealthModifierPercent * -100]}% of your base health every {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.TickRate]} seconds for {[Afflictions.AfflictionBlight.AfflictedDrainTime]} seconds.
At the end of this timer, the player with the lowest health is afflicted with Combustible.
If you run out of resistance, a silence zone will be cast on you. The zone will detonate after a time, dealing damage to players. Resistance is shared among all members of your group.

If you run out of resistance, a Weary zone will be cast on you, slowing your movement and increasing all damage you take. Using abilities increases resistance. Resistance is shared among all members of your group.
While wounded, you regain stamina at a much lower rate.
While corrupted, you lose {[Type_StatusEffectData.Curse.HealthModifierPercent * 100]}% base health instantly.
While frostbitten, you cannot run or dodge.
While suffering acid burn, you take 500% more damage from acid. You can remove Acid Burn with Acid Tnctures which can be crafted at an arcane station.
You are stunned and can't move.
While spore drenched, you take 25% increased damage from all sources.

While blighted, you deal {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.DMGStandard * 100]}% reduced damage, take {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealMod * 100]}% reduced healing, and lose {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealthModifierPercent * 100]}% of your base health every {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.TickRate]} seconds.
When this timer expires, the player with the lowest percent health becomes Combustible.
Using abilities will fill the bar. Blowback is cast on all players once full.
By continuing, you agree to the

All confidential information you receive or learn by participating in the Test or otherwise relating to the Game Materials, including their existence, technology, features, gameplay, look and feel, and any plans for release, must be kept strictly confidential under the nondisclosure agreement(s) you signed when you joined Amazon ("NDA") and the requirements below. Amazon is very serious about this - if you disclose, intentionally or unintentionally, anything about the Test or the Game Materials, you risk loss of your job and possible legal action.

Use [{keyName}] to place your camp. You can use the camp to rest or craft, and you can respawn there if you die. Placing and removing your camp is free, but you can only have one camp at a time.
Hold [{keyName}] to deconstruct your camp so you can place it in a new location. Placing and removing your camp is free, but you can only have one camp at a time.

Azoth can be used for fast travel between shrines and settlements and to craft more powerful items.

Acquire Azoth by completing Quests and closing Corruption Breaches.

Elysian Wilds is covered in deadly spores that will kill you in an insant. You will die if you continue.\n You must own Rise of the Angry Earth, reach level 60 and complete <font color="#FFD500">"The Invasion of Artemis"</font> {location} to safely enter Elysian Wilds.

 Dealing damage (including blocked hits).

 Taking damage (including blocked hits).

 Applying buffs (including heals) and debuffs.

quills (quills): Hello World. If anyone wants to join my company, you can for 50 dinars.

Respawning at the inn would trigger the inn cooldown. Since this settlement is the closest one to you, you should respawn at the settlement and save the inn cooldown for when you're closer to a different settlement.

Respawning at your house would trigger your house cooldown. Since this settlement is the closest one to you, you should respawn at the settlement and save your house cooldown for when you're closer to a different settlement.
Repeated deaths while flagged for PvP will put camp respawn locations on a cooldown.\nRespawning at a non-camp location will reset this timer.
This will put this respawn position in cooldown. Continue?
{territoryName} : Pay property upkeep to respawn at your house.

and <font color="#FFFFFF"><font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{friendCount}</font></font> other friends are online now
Leaving a world impacts your character's experience:
Your Friends List will not carry over
Your Company membership and any funds in the treasury will not carry over
Your Town Project missions will not carry over
Your Faction missions will not carry over
Your Trading Post contracts will not carry over and will be cancelled
Your Season Pass progress and rewards will carry over
Are you sure you want to leave {worldName}?\n\nOnce you leave this world, you may not be able to return until it is unlocked and can only select a world in this region.
This world ({worldName}) is being merged into {destinationWorldName} on {date}.

Character XP helps you level up your character.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Completing Missions, Crafting, Killing Enemies, Participating in Events</font>

Faction Reputation unlocks new items at the Faction Shop.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Completing Faction Missions</font>

Increasing Territory Standing allows you to purchase a house and add in territory specific benefits.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Missions, quests, town projects, or territory supplies within a territory</font>

Influence measures a faction's control of a Territory. Reaching 100% Territory Influence enables a declaration of war.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Completing PvP Faction missions</font>

Faction Tokens are used to purchase items at the Faction Shop.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Completing Faction missions, PvP rewards</font>

Project Points are used to track completion for Town Projects set by Governors.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Town Project Missions</font>

PvP XP advances you through the PvP Track's checkpoints. Unlock checkpoints to purchase rewards.\n\n<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> PvP Activities</font>
Special XP Boost is active in this world!
<font color="#FFFFFF" face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Regular.font">Come and enjoy the glorious XP Boost event! This is the chance to level up your characters!\nThe boost is activated on:</font>

Fortunes of the Bold Rafflebones daily limit reached
The optimal WORLD has been selected for you
A World Set is a collection of selected Worlds. Worlds within a World Set may be merged together if necessary to give players the best experience.
How many characters can I have per World Set?
You can have 1 character per World Set. You will need to delete your character if you want to play in another world within a World Set as characters cannot be transferred or move to other worlds.

your body will remain for <font color="#ffd45f">[{timeremaining}]</font> in the world.

You were killed by an innocent!

You are no longer a Criminal!
You have been marked as a Murderer!

Primary attribute for the War Hammer, Great Axe, Sword, Hatchet, Blunderbuss and Flail.

Secondary attribute for the Spear.

Greatsword scales evenly with this attribute and Dexterity.

Primary attribute for the Bow, Rapier, Spear and Musket.

Secondary attribute for the Sword, and Hatchet.

Greatsword scales evenly with this attribute and Strength.
Primary attribute for the Fire Staff, Ice Gauntlet, and Void Gauntlet.\n\nSecondary attribute for the Rapier, Musket and Blunderbuss.
Primary attribute for the Life Staff.\n\nSecondary attribute for the Void Gauntlet and Flail.

FAITH

Putting points into Faith increases:

-- Total Mana
-- Defense against Void Damage
-- Corruption Resistance

-- Spell Potency of Celestial Casting Gauntlets

PHYSIQUE

Putting points into Physique increases:

-- Defense against Physical Damage
-- Poison Resistance
-- Maximum Equip Load

ENDURANCE

Putting points into Endurance increases:

-- Stamina
-- Defense against Lightning Damage
-- Wound Resistance
Recover and reassign your Attribute Points.
The maximum amount of weight that the Character can carry in their backpack.
The maximum amount of weight that the Character can have equipped on their person.
The Character's resistance to Afflictions. It acts as a pool that is depleted by affliction damage.
The amount of Wound Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Poison Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Frostbite Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Corruption Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Disease Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of reduction applied to unblocked damage before Absorption is calculated.

string.comment: We want to use a pipe character '|' between these and a percent '%' after absorption because that's how the numbers are ultimately displayed

resources.string:
You have <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{defense} Defense</font> against this type of damage. Defense is determined by your attributes and how much armor you have, but not what type.

You have <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{absorption}% Absorption</font> against this type of damage. Absorption is determined by your equipment's stats.

When you take damage, it is reduced first by your defense value, then by your absorption percent.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Standard</font> type damage is shared by many weapons and creatures.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Slash</font> type damage is generally more effective against flesh.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Magic</font> type damage is generally more effective against the corrupted.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Fire</font> type damage is generally more effective against flesh.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Thrust</font> type damage is generally more effective against heavy armor.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Strike</font> type damage is generally more effective against light armor.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Lightning</font> type damage is generally more effective against creatures.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Void</font> type damage is generally more effective against the uncorrupted.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Siege</font> type damage is generally more effective against structures.
The percentage reduction applied to incoming damage after it has been reduced by Defense.
You have placed all of these items.
You can't build on territory claimed by someone else.
You must claim this land before you can build on it.
Continue your story to join a faction
Faction influence in this territory will not change until the current conflict is over.
Area is too populated! You will be teleported soon.
Your respawn destination was unavailable, you have been teleported nearby.
Cannot reclaim until the end of Resolution phase.
Cannot be claimed as a 3rd party until War ends.

During an Influence Race, factions earn Influence through <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" >PvP Faction Missions</font> and <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" >Faction Control Points</font>. Faction Control Points give the controlling faction a bonus to all Influence Earned. 

The Attacking Faction that pushes the most Influence during an Influence Race earns a declaration of war. Companies must complete Faction Missions to earn enough Influence to be eligible to declare. 

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" >Underdog Bonus:</font> Factions with 2 less territories owned earn an added <font color="#FFFFFF">10%</font> Influence Point Bonus.
More MATERIALS and Appropriate STATION needed
{distance} away\n<font color="#ff2e2e">Respawn not available outside of {maxDistance}.</font>

Use [{keyName}] to enable planning mode. Planning mode allows you to place blueprints for structures in your company's territory. Your rank within your company must have permission to place structures.
The hourly cost to protect your territory.
Building Allowed Only On Claimed Territory
You can now be revived again.
Your Soul Returns to the New World
You can be revived again in

While you are a criminal, other players can attack you without committing a crime themselves, even in sanctuaries. If you die, you drop your equipment in addition to your inventory.\n\nCurrent Crimes: {crimeList}
You must claim all Capture Points first!
You can only attack other players if they are also <font color="#ff9900">flagged for PvP</font> and in an <font color="#ff9900">opposing Faction</font>.\n\nFlag for PvP inside a Sanctuary.
Turning on criminal intent will allow you to damage innocent players and their structures.
Respecs are awarded at levels 1-10, 15, 25, 40, and 60.\nAfter Level 60, Attribute Respecs are awarded at even levels, Skill Respecs at odd levels.
You cannot turn on Criminal Intent in a Sanctuary
Cannot declare war on a Company of the same Faction.
Cannot declare war without joining a Faction.
Your Company Rank does not have permission to build here
Your Company Rank does not have permission to plant here

Unlock Camp (Tier 1)
Placing a Tier 1 camp allows you to craft various Tier 1 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.
To unlock, you must be Level 5 and have completed the starting survivalist quest.
Note: You must complete the preceding starting settlement and beach quests before undertaking this quest.
Cannot build this outside of war
Are you sure you want to consume this item? Consuming it will cause a significant change to your character and cannot be undone.
Report capture complete. Hit Escape->Exit Options->Defect Reporter to view.
The report has been successfully uploaded!
While in a sanctuary, players cannot damage other players even if they are flagged for PVP.
You cannot damage other players in a Sanctuary area.
Players cannot damage other players in this area.

While in a lawless area, you will not be marked as a criminal for any crimes you commit.\n\nYou must still enable criminal intent to damage any non-criminals, but you will not receive the usual penalties.
Entering Lawless Area. No crime penalties here.
Leaving Lawless Area. Crime penalties are active.
Are you sure you want to open the Steam Store?

string.comment: May display like Uncommon Fine Sword Burning, sometimes type, material, or magic will be blank.

resources.string: Equip to Leather Apparel; “A tree is felled in an empty forest, and yes, it does make a sound."
Equip to Hatchet; "It was clear the intent was to split more than simply cords of wood.“
Do you have tickets? To the musket show?
Make your house a home with the Bobcat house pet. They make the purr-fect companion.
Make your house a home with the Hare house pet. We guarantee a "hare raising" experience.
Make your house a home with the Woodland Mastiff house pet. The goodest boy in all of Aeternum.
Rock, Paper, Scissors, a light-hearted game with friends or a tool for making difficult decisions.
Show Steam Overlay in Steam's Settings
Items have been added to or removed from your account.
If you or anyone in your family have an epileptic condition, consult your physician prior to playing New World.

A very small percentage of individuals may experience epileptic seizures when exposed to certain visual images, including light patterns or flashing lights that may appear in video game or other video content. Exposure to certain patterns or backgrounds on a computer screen or while playing video games may induce an epileptic seizure in these individuals. Certain conditions may induce previously undetected epileptic symptoms even in persons who have no history of prior seizures or epilepsy.

If you experience any of the following symptoms while playing - dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitches, loss of awareness, disorientation, any involuntary movement, or convulsions - discontinue use IMMEDIATELY and consult your physician before resuming use of New World.
New World is a work of supernatural fiction about cultures from around the world banding together to fight for the fate of humanity.
The New World team consulted with experts and our diverse workforce on the depictions of the cultures we've drawn from and will continue to do so as we add more in the future.
If you or anyone in your family have a history of seizures or epilepsy, consult your doctor prior to playing.
Get the Latest News & Offers from Aeternum!
This place is too busy to respawn.
You must be within <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{distance}</font> of the camp to respawn.
Can respawn in <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{time}</font> within <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{distance}</font> of the camp.
Stash items here. Other players cannot take or see your items.
Visit a Storage Shed to access stored items.
+ (Hold) Zoom
Other players can not take or see items you leave here. You must return to this outpost to retrieve items.

Cannot declare war if you are not in a Company.
Cannot declare war against your own Company.
Cannot declare war, you are already at war with this Company for control of another territory.
Cannot declare a war, your company has a pending war declaration.
Cannot declare war until current battle is resolved.

Cannot declare a war, this territory has an upcoming invasion.\n\nFaction Influence is frozen at the value it was at before the invasion was declared and will immediately return to that value after the invasion.
Cannot declare war, no player component.
Cannot declare war, not enough coin.
Cannot declare war, your Company has no faction.
Cannot declare war, defender is in your faction.
Cannot declare war, defender has no territory.

You can only declare war on a territory during the time of the defender's Siege Window. This will reserve your war time for the Siege Window of the following day.\n\nNOTES: If other companies submit war declarations along with you, there will be a lottery to determine who gets the war reservation. If your company isn't chosen, your coin will be refunded.

You can only declare war on a territory during the time of the defender's Siege Window. This will reserve your war time for the Siege Window of the following day.\n\nNOTES: If other companies submit war declarations along with you, there will be a lottery to determine who gets the war reservation. If your company isn't chosen, your coin will be refunded.
Cannot declare war, your Company rank doesn't have this permission.
Cannot declare war, your faction does not yet have enough influence to cause a conflict.
War has been disabled due to a pending world merge.

Cannot declare war until the Influence Race is complete and your faction is the winner.

You can transfer items to and from storage sheds in settlements you have visited.

Allows players to send you Duel invites
Automatically climb and vault over obstacles while moving
Allows Alerts to be displayed while in menus that would otherwise hide chat. Control which channels can display Alerts in the channel selector to the left.
When checked, chat will close when you send a message, returning you to whatever else you were doing. When unchecked, chat will remain open so you can quickly send additional messages.
How long before messages begin to fade away during gameplay.
Opacity of a dark background to place behind chat messages to increase contrast. Set to 0 to disable.
Opacity of new messages that arrive during gameplay, while menus are closed.

string.comment: {dayOfWeek} is abbreviated day text ('Mon', 'Tues'). {month} will be abbreviated month text ('Jan', 'Feb', etc.). {date} is the number of day of the month. The English format might be 'Mon, Oct 29'
Similar to ui_date_format but with full day and month names
Similar to ui_date_format but using numbers for month day and year (10/13/21)
{stationName} is the type of station, like 'Blacksmith'. {tier} is the required tier. {current} is the current tier.
{skillName} is the type of skill, like 'Blacksmithing'. {level} is for required skill level. {current} is for current skill level.

{skillName} is the type of skill, like 'Blacksmithing'. {skillLoc} is currently being replaced by the word for 'Skill'. If another language needs to be something like 'Skill Blacksmithing', these need to be swapped around.{required} is for required skill level.
{skillName} is the type of skill, like 'Blacksmithing'.

resources.string: You must respawn before you can respond to this notification.

string.comment: Use {currentValue} and {maxValue} for the vital's numbers

resources.string: HEALTH {currentValue} / {maxValue} To regain health • Consume tinctures to regain it quickly • Consume food to regain it slowly over time after a quick increase Upgrade Constitution to increase your maximum health. indicates the player is currently engaged in combat. Some player management actions are restricted while the combat state is active. Complete an engagement or avoid combat for 10s to exit the state.

string.comment: Use {currentValue} and {maxValue} for the vital's numbers

resources.string:
<font color={headerColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">STAMINA</font>
<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">{currentValue} / {maxValue}</font>

Defensive actions like blocking or dodging will drain your <font color={highlightColor}>stamina</font>, and if you run out you may be unable to perform those actions until it replenishes.

<font color={highlightColor}>Stamina</font> replenishes on its own over time unless you are sprinting or attacking.

string.comment: Use {currentValue} and {maxValue} for the vital's numbers

resources.string:
<font color={headerColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">MANA</font>
<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">{currentValue} / {maxValue}</font>

A mysterious resource required in order to use magic. If this is low, you may be unable to make use of certain supernatural abilities.

<font color={highlightColor}>Mana</font> replenishes over time.

string.comment: Use {currentValue} and {maxValue} for the vital's numbers

resources.string:
<font color={headerColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">MOUNT STAMINA</font>
<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">{currentValue} / {maxValue}</font>

Allows your mount to travel at higher speeds and depletes as you dash.

<font color={highlightColor}>Mount Stamina</font> replenishes on its own over time unless you are dashing.
Mana replenishes over time.\n\n Base 1.5 mana per second.
Decreases the amount of time before you are able to use an ability again.

string.comment: Use {currentValue} and {maxValue} for the vital's numbers

resources.string:
Food
{currentValue} / {maxValue}

Eating increases the rate your health regenerates. If your food is too low, you could stop healing altogether!

You will not lose health due to hunger. It only affects the regeneration rate.

string.comment: Use {currentValue} and {maxValue} for the vital's numbers

resources.string:
Drink
{currentValue} / {maxValue}

Staying hydrated increases the rate your stamina regenerates. Keep it high to maximize your effectiveness.

You will not lose stamina due to thirst. It only affects the regeneration rate.

After being away from New World for a time, you become rested. While rested, you earn XP at an improved rate until your rested XP is expended.
You have reached the Azoth cap. Excess Azoth will be lost.

You have reached the Coin cap. Excess Coin will be lost.
You are almost at the Coin cap: {amount}/{maxAmount}
You have reached the Faction Reputation cap. Excess reputation will be lost.
You are almost at the Faction Reputation cap: {amount}/{maxAmount}
You have reached the Azoth Salt cap. Excess Azoth Salt will be lost.

Opening this will put you at the Azoth Salt cap. Excess Azoth Salt will be lost.
You have reached the Faction Tokens cap. Excess tokens will be lost.
You are almost at the Faction Tokens cap: {amount}/{maxAmount}
Company Treasuries are capped at {amount} Coin.\nThis amount is the most you could give without exceeding that limit.
Your wallet is capped at {amount} Coin.\nThis amount is the most you could take without exceeding that limit.
Your wallet is capped at {amount} Coin.\nYou will lose any Coin that exceeds that limit at the time of sale.
Your wallet is capped at {amount} Coin.\nThe other player is trying to give you more Coin than you can carry and will be refunded any excess Coin.
Your wallet is full. You cannot withdraw any Coin from your Company Treasury.
Longer listings will result in higher listing fees.
Unlocking a higher tier of camping allows you to craft more items at your campsite.

Camp (Tier 1)

Placing a Tier 1 camp allows you to craft various Tier 1 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 2, you must complete “Seed of Hope” in Windsward or "Wilderness Wiseman" in Monarch's Bluffs.

Camp (Tier 2)

Placing a Tier 2 camp allows you to craft various Tier 2 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 3, you must complete "Losing the Faith" in Brightwood.

Camp (Tier 3)

Placing a Tier 3 camp allows you to craft various Tier 3 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 4, you must be Level 40 and have completed the “Survivalist: Lupine Obersvations” quest.

Camp (Tier 4)

Placing a Tier 4 camp allows you to craft various Tier 4 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 5, you must be Level 55 and have completed the “Survivalist: Fading Lights” quest.
Camp (Tier 5)\n\nPlacing a Tier 5 camp allows you to craft various Tier 5 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.
Applied on the next camp built.
Shield stats and perks are only applied if you have a sword or flail equipped and unsheathed.\n\nIf you are not using a sword or flail, consider unequipping the shield to reduce your equip load.

Only Call of the Wilds participants can create characters in {worldName}.
Characters may transfer to and from this world.
Characters cannot transfer to this world.\n Characters may transfer from this world.
Characters may transfer to this world.\n Characters cannot transfer from this world.
Characters cannot transfer to this world.\n Characters cannot transfer from this world.

<font color="#FFFFFF">You can only have 1 character in the {worldSetName} world group.</font>

If you ever want to play on a different {worldSetName} world, you will need to delete your character on {worldName} and create a new one on a different world.

If you have friends playing on other {worldSetName} worlds, you will not be able to play with them.
You already have a character in the {worldSetName} world group. If you want to play on this world, you must delete your character on {worldName}.
Free player sessions are extended every 30 minutes if there are no paid players in the queue. Players who have purchased New World do not have session time limits.
Only new characters can be created in {worldName}. Characters cannot transfer to this Fresh Start World. Only players who have purchased New World may create characters on Fresh Start worlds.
You have the maximum number of characters in this region. To create a new character, delete an existing character in this region, or choose another region.
This world's population will be merged with {worldName} on {time}.
Will I keep my character progression, inventory, and house?
Will my Company keep their claimed territories?
Can my Company still declare war on other Companies?
Your character's level, attribute points, mastery points, territory standing, house, inventory, and settlement storage will be preserved.

Territories on the new world will be claimed by the Companies of that world. If your Company is not of that world, you lose all your territories, any upgrades, and your company will be given {coinAmount} coin.
Players will never be split up from each other due to a World merge, and the Company membership and wallet will be preserved.

Players will receive {bufferTime} notice when a World merge is to happen. Companies cannot declare war during this time. Pending wars will be cancelled, and gold spent to declare war will be fully refunded.
You have one or more characters in Worlds that will be merged soon:
One or more of your characters have been moved as the result of a world merge.
Did I keep my character progression, inventory, and house?
Did my company keep our territories?
Did my open Buy/Sell contracts remain posted?
Your character's level, attribute points, mastery points, territory standing, house, inventory, and settlement storage have been preserved.

Territories on the new world will be claimed by the Companies of that world. If your Company is not of that world, you lose all your territories, any upgrades, and your company will be given {coinAmount} coin.
Players will never be split up from each other due to a World merge, and the Company membership and wallet have been preserved. Wars cannot be declared {bufferTime} before the merge.
Items posted for sale will be returned to you, and you will retain coin earned from partial sales. Coin paid for taxes or listing fees will not be returned.
This character is not bound to any world. Select one to move your character's progress and items to the selected world.

An A.I. directed set of Multi GPU headless clients that utilize spectator cameras to record live video of events from within New World and broadcast them on the official Twitch New World channel and the in-game client.

<font color={headerColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">EXPERTISE</font>
Expertise is used to measure the maximum power of an item when you have it equipped.

<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">Max Expertise that you can reach</font>
<font color={highlightColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{maximum}</font>


<font color={headerColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">HOW TO INCREASE EXPERTISE</font>

<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">Elite POIs and Expeditions</font>
Drops from creatures or chests in level 60+ areas have a chance to increase this value.

<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">Crafting</font>
Crafting a 600 GS item will increase Expertise of this item type.

<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">Gypsum Cast</font>
Opening a Gypsum Cast will increase Expertise.

<font color={subHeaderColor} face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_SemiBold.font">Item Upgrade (with Umbral Shards)</font>
After you reach 600 Expertise, the only way to increase Expertise is via upgrading items with Umbral Shards.
({value} + {additional} from Umbral Upgrade)
({value} + {additional} from Umbral Upgrades)
The maximum from enemies, chests, Gyspsum Casts, and crafting is 600.
To exceed 600, upgrade an item of this type with Umbral Shards.
Open the map and select a location you wish to travel to. You can spend Azoth to fast travel between Settlements, Outposts, and Spirit Shrines you have previously visited.
In the map, uncharted Spirit Shrines are displayed as .\nShrines you have previously visited are displayed as .
The amount of Azoth required to fast travel to a location increases based on your inventory weight. Travel light, friends.

After enough fish are caught at a hotspot, it will become depleted. You can tell a hotspot is depleted when there are no fish jumping. A depleted hotspot will become active again after some time has passed.

You can tell a fishing hotspot is active when you see fish jumping out of it. While it’s active, landing your cast within the hotspot will yield quicker bites and rarer fish. When you place your line correctly, you’ll see a small alert telling you you’ve hit the hotspot.
So you’ve hit Level 60! Congratulations! The world of Aeternum is now completely open to you. Here are the highlights of what life is like in the endgame.

At Level 60 you have access to several new expeditions: Garden of Genesis in Edengrove, The Lazarus Instrumentality in Reekwater, Tempest’s Heart in Shattered Mountain, and Barnacles and Black Powder in Cutlass Keys.\n\nKeep an eye out for the circular red icon around two Expeditions at a time on the map—this means that Expedition is currently Mutated and offers higher difficulties but greater rewards. Some of the best endgame rewards come from the end bosses in Mutated Expeditions (more on that later).

At Level 60, you gain access to Outpost Rush. You can queue for the mode from any Faction representative, or some NPCs in Northern outposts, or the Modes tab on the nav bar. You can enter a queue solo or with a group of up to five.

The mode is a 20v20 PvPvE instanced battleground. There are three outposts which can be claimed to generate points for your team. They can be upgraded via gathering resources in the area and adding them to the gates, cannons, and more. To win, you’ll need to claim and hold these outposts, and the first team to 1,000 points wins the match.

As long as you make a minimum contribution of 500 points for your team, either through PvP or PvE, you will get rewards at the end of the match.

When a territory is under attack from the Corrupted, you can sign up at the local War Board or the Upcoming Wars tab on the Map Screen to help defend the territory. Any faction can sign up, and there are 40 open slots chosen by the system each time. Invasions come in 6 waves, and the fort must be defended from being claimed by the Corrupted. If they do, the local settlement will experience random downgrades to its crafting stations or local lifestyle buffs.

Gypsum is the way to increase your expertise in a specific gear type.

Gypsum comes in different varieties, each of which can be used at a Gypsum Kiln to craft a Gypsum Orb. You’ll need a certain quantity of each type in order to craft 1 Gypsum Orb. A Gypsum Orb can then be used to create a Gypsum Cast of a specific gear type, which once consumed will grant a guaranteed Expertise bump for the chosen gear type and grant a new piece of gear of the higher gear score.

You can obtain Gypsum in various quantities by engaging in different activities as follows:

•Obsidian Gypsum, 3 per day – Level 60+ open-world named bosses, typically found in Elite Landmarks.
•Sapphire Gypsum, 2 per day – Lazarus Instrumentality and Garden of Genesis final bosses.
•Ruby Gypsum, 2 per day – Outpost Rush (must get at least 501 points in the match).
•Emerald Gypsum, 1 per day – Trade Skill Aptitude Reward Checkpoints.
•Citrine Gypsum, 2 per day – PvE arenas.
•Amethyst Gypsum, 7 per day – Closing Corrupted Breaches.
•Topaz Gypsum, 5 per day – Go to an Arcana Station or Tier 5 camp to craft an Attunement Potion. Drink the potion, then kill level 55+ enemies who will drop Topaz Gypsum.
•Diamond Gypsum, 3 per day – You can obtain Diamond Gypsum by gathering any type of node in Aeternum. This usually changes during Seasonal Events such as the Winter Convergence.
•Garnet Gypsum, 2 per day – 3v3 PVP Arenas.

At Level 60, you gain access to the Season Journey. Each new Season features added adventures and bonus items for completing these adventures during the season timeline. Access the exclusive experience before the season ends!
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#ffdb7a">Elite</font> landmarks, Trial Arenas, and open world challenges for groups
Visit a <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#ffdb7a">Gypsum Kiln</font> to upgrade your gear
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#ffdb7a">Season Journey</font> features exclusive adventures and awards for each season

During the Free Weekend event, any player may download New World and create a character to play. Some worlds are restricted to players who have purchased New World. Free players may not transfer characters between worlds nor access the Store and Trading Post. Free player characters are also restricted to a maximum of 2,000 .

Use the Social Menu (default: [O]) to search for friends in the same world or respond to invites from other players. Participate and join multiplayer activities such as Arena and Outpost Rush from the Modes tab in the Escape Menu [ESC]. Find a party and embark on an Expedition by opening the Group Finder menu from the map by hovering over any Expedition’s icon.

For free players, New World periodically checks to see if there is a queue for their character’s world. Players may play as long as they like if their world has no queue when this session time check is made. If there is a queue at that time, the free player will be returned to the Main Menu and may queue to reenter the world. If there is no queue at that time, the free player’s session time will be extended until the next check. Players who have purchased New World do not have session time checks and have queue priority over free players.

New World can be purchased through the Steam Store, which can be accessed from the Main Menu or the Menu button via the Escape Menu [ESC]. All characters, items, and progress earned as a free player will be carried forward after purchasing New World. However, only the total time played by all characters on an account after purchase will accrue towards unlocking features such as Player-to-Player Trading and access to the Store and Trading Post.

Before joining a faction, you must prove yourself by completing a series of Faction Initiation Quests. Reach Level 17 and seek out the initial quest givers for each faction in or near the village of Oxboro in Everfall.

By joining a faction, you get access to Faction Missions, open world PvP, and Wars. You will be able to take part in shifting control of territories towards your faction.\n\nAdventuring within a territory your faction controls will grant several varying bonuses, such as increased XP gain.
Players in a faction can form companies and invite other players who are either in the same faction or not in any faction. The players without a faction still cannot take part in PvP or join Wars.

Companies have the potential to make their leader the Governor of a territory by winning a War against its current owners. See Declaring War in the Player versus Player (PvP) and War guide for more info on how to start and fight Wars.

Once you are in a faction, you can choose to enable your PvP Flag. Enabling your PvP Flag allows you to participate in open world player vs. player combat. While your flag is enabled, you can attack and be attacked by other flagged players from the other factions.\n\nTo toggle your PvP Flag on or off, press the Toggle PvP button (default: U) while in a Settlement or any other sanctuary.

Flagged players can battle at each Fort for its control.

To take part, flag for PvP then go to the Fort you wish to compete for and enter through any of the gates. Once inside, claim and hold your ground against players from the other factions.

The faction that holds the Fort gains bonuses in the territory like increased influence and XP gains for faction members. Owning a Fort does not affect overall control of the territory, but may be instrumental in declaring a war for ownership.

Capture Influence Towers and strike down enemy Factions in open world combat for territorial supremacy. Each Faction will compete for Influence in specific zones during scheduled times. 

If an attacking Faction earns enough Influence through PvP Missions, Influence Towers, and Forts before the race ends, they’ll receive bonus rewards, plus the opportunity to declare War. 

If the defending Faction prevents the attackers from scoring enough Influence within the time limit, they’ll earn bonus rewards for both the Influence Race and the next War. 

Regardless of who wins, the attacking Faction with the most influence can escalate the conflict into War.

Players may sign up to participate in a scheduled Siege battle at the War Board in the territory's Settlement or outside its Fort.

The Governors of the two leading companies may choose from the players that have signed up for their side to build their 50 player armies.

If chosen to participate, an invite banner will appear shortly before the Siege battle is scheduled to begin. If you accept, you will be teleported to you army's spawn area for the battle to prepare. If you decline, your spot will open for a player assigned to the army's backfill list.

Players from the attacking or defending faction may only sign up for their faction's side of the War. Players from the third faction may sign up for either side. Players without a faction may not join Wars.

During a Siege battle, the two teams first battle for control of three points outside the Fort.

Defenders start in control of all three points. Attackers claim points by keeping players within the claim ring.

Once all three claim points are taken, the Attackers must destroy the Fort's gates to access a final claim point in the central yard.

The Attackers win the War if they can claim the final point before the battle's time limit expires.
Any qualifying player can join the instanced player vs. player game modes regardless of faction alignment. These modes are found in the Modes screen from the main navigation menu.

Outpost Rush is a 20 vs. 20 match that takes place on a large island with three Outposts.

Teams score points by capturing and holding outposts.

The first team to 1,000 points wins the match.

The island features special resources and creatures that can be harnessed by the teams to swing the battle in their favor.

In 3v3 Arenas, two teams battle to eliminate each other. The match takes place in a best of five format.

Eliminate the entire opposing team to win a round.

Win three rounds to win the match.

Consumables are not allowed. The longer a round continues, the weaker healing abilities become. And If the round lasts too long, a ring of fire will begin to close until one side has won.

When an item is added to your inventory, it's automatically added to your Transmog Collection and is available to Transmog into a skin.\n\nYou do not need to possess the item after it's been added to your Transmog Collection to Transmog it into a skin.
Go to the Transmog Station , find the item, and use Transmog Tokens to create a skin.\n\nTransmog skins are account-wide (able to use on any of your characters).

You can summon your mount with {$player.mount_summon$}. Walk with {$movement.walk$}, sprint with {$player.mount_dash$}, and jump with {$movement.jump$}. Sprinting and jumping cost mount stamina. Falling from great heights and being hit by enemies reduces its stamina. You can replenish stamina by feeding your mount. If its stamina gets too low you will be dismounted.

Transmog Tokens can be used at the Stylemancer to create skins from items you have acquired.

You do not need to possess the item to create a skin once acquired.

<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#aaaaaa">Source:</font> <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_medium.font" color="#FFFFFF"> Rewards, Events, Store</font>
